headline: Compared to Estimates, Digital Realty Trust (DLR) Q1 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: The headline numbers for Digital Realty Trust (DLR) give insight into how the company performed in the quarter ended March 2025, but it may be worthwhile to compare some of its key metrics to Wall Street estimates and the year-ago actuals.

headline: Digital Realty lifts annual FFO forecast on strong data center demand
summary: Digital Realty Trust raised its annual core funds from operations (FFO) forecast on Thursday, betting on strong demand for data center services, sending its shares up 3.3% in extended trading. The surge in digital transformation and growing investment by hyperscale customers developing and integrating artificial intelligence models are driving demand for data services, boosting new bookings and renewals for data center operators such as Digital Realty. "Robust demand across our key product segments drove strong leasing and acceleration in Core FFO per share growth in the first quarter," said CEO Andy Power.

headline: Digital Realty Trust (DLR) Q1 FFO Top Estimates
summary: Digital Realty Trust (DLR) delivered FFO and revenue surprises of 2.31% and 1.03%, respectively, for the quarter ended March 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Digital Realty Trust: Q1 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The Dallas-based real estate investment trust said it had funds from operations of $608.4 million, or $1.77 per share, in the period. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for funds from operations of $1.73 per share. Funds from operations is a closely watched measure in the REIT industry.

headline: Digital Realty Reports First Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Digital Realty (NYSE: DLR), the largest global provider of cloud- and carrier-neutral data center, colocation, and interconnection solutions, announced today financial results for the first quarter of 2025. All per share results are presented on a fully diluted basis.

headline: Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR) Expands Global Azure ExpressRoute Peering with Three New Locations
summary: Digital Realty Trust (NYSE:DLR) announced the expansion of its Azure ExpressRoute locations, enhancing its partnership with Microsoft and potentially increasing its connectivity offering. Over the past week, the company's shares rose by 2.3%, aligning with the broader market's gain of the same percentage. While the market was buoyed by positive earnings from tech stocks, Digital Realty's recent client and service announcements likely added some weight to this gain, reinforcing its strategic...

headline: Digital Realty Deploys Three Microsoft Azure ExpressRoute Cloud On-Ramps
summary: Digital Realty (NYSE: DLR), a global provider of cloud- and carrier-neutral data center, colocation, and interconnection solutions, today announced new Microsoft Azure ExpressRoute peering locations in Atlanta, Brussels, and Vienna, enabling customers to establish a dedicated connection from their private IT infrastructure to Azure services via a single cross connect.
